entries.meaning: An advisement providing more up-to-date information than currently known.
examples: He gave me an update on the situation in New York.

entries.meaning: A change in information, a modification of existing or known data.
examples: I just made an update to the Wikipedia article on guerillas.

entries.meaning: An additional piece of information. An addition to existing information.
examples: I just made an update to my blog about my trip to Rome.

entries.meaning: A modification of something to a more recent, up-to-date version; (in software) a minor upgrade.
examples: Our database receives an update every morning at 3 AM.
I have a couple of updates to install on your laptop.

entries.meaning: A version of something which is newer than other versions.
examples: You should try the update: it rocks.

verbs.description: update (third-person singular simple present updates, present participle updating, simple past and past participle updated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To bring (a thing) up to date.
examples: I need to update my records to take account of the most recent transaction.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To bring (a person) up to date: to inform (a person) about recent developments.
examples: Update me on what happened while I was away.
